text: Oreta liensis is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Watson in 1967. It is found in China (Yunnan, Heilongjiang, Hubei, Fujian, Sichuan)., 2012: Revision of Chinese Oretinae (Lepidoptera, Drepanidae). Zootaxa 3445: 1-36. The length of the forewings is 19.5–21 mm. There are two forms, one has the dark areas reddish brown and pale areas yellow, while the other has the yellow areas replaced by pale reddish brown. The markings at the anal angle of the forewings are nearly black.Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History) (Entomology) 19 (3): 170 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1967 Category:Drepaninae
title: Oreta liensis
